intro: Leandra attenuata, commonly known as the red-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety red leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink to white. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Leandra attenuata prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure.
